revised_title: Boiling Phenomena in Vessels and the Role of Evaporation
tldr: The author, Charles Tomlinson, investigates the phenomenon of boiling in a vessel contained in a water bath. He discusses historical experiments and observations, and through his own experiments, he concludes that the inferior temperature of water in a tube is due to evaporation. This study contributes to the understanding of boiling phenomena and the role of evaporation in heat transfer.
